channel.title: BBC News | News Front Page | World Edition
channel.description: Visit BBC News for up-to-the-minute news, breaking news, video, audio and feature stories. BBC News provides trusted World and UK news as well as local and regional perspectives. Also entertainment, business, science, technology and health news.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse

item.title: Kosovo on brink of independence
item.description: Kosovo's parliament begins an emergency session to declare formal independence from Serbia.

item.title: 'Deadliest' attack in Afghanistan
item.description: A suicide bomb kills at least 80 people in the Afghan city of Kandahar in seemingly the deadliest attack since 2001.

item.title: Greek Cypriots vote for president
item.description: Greek Cypriots vote in a presidential election that is seen as pivotal for efforts to reunite Cyprus.

item.title: Bush calls for fair Zimbabwe poll
item.description: US President George W Bush calls for free and fair elections in Zimbabwe, as he continues his African tour.

item.title: Call for calm after Pakistan bomb
item.description: The leader of Pakistan's main opposition party urges calm after a bomb kills 37 at a rally ahead of polls on Monday.

item.title: India police battle Maoist rebels
item.description: There is heavy fighting between police and Maoist rebels hiding in a jungle in the Indian state of Orissa.

item.title: Madagascar braced for cyclone
item.description: People in Madagascar are braced for a tropical cyclone which is expected to make landfall in the north-east.

item.title: US spy satellite plan 'a cover'
item.description: Russia says US plans to shoot down a broken spy satellite are a cover for testing an anti-satellite weapon.

item.title: Nazi-era singer returns to stage
item.description: A 104-year-old Dutch cabaret singer who once performed for the Nazis gives a concert for the first time in decades.

item.title: Cricket: India slump to Aussies
item.description: Australia move well clear in the CB Series table after a 50-run win over India in a low-scoring match in Adelaide.

item.title: Athletics: Bekele sets new record
item.description: Kenenisa Bekele eclipses Haile Gebrselassie's two-mile world record at the Norwich Union Grand Prix in Birmingham.

item.title: UN troops 'trapped' in Eritrea
item.description: The UN condemns Eritrea, saying its peacekeepers are being prevented from leaving the country.

item.title: Unused hospital razed in Nigeria
item.description: A fully-equipped hospital the government refused to open for two years burns to the ground in northern Nigeria.

item.title: Canada sends ex-SS guard to Italy
item.description: A former Nazi prison guard, 83, arrives in Italy from Canada to serve a life sentence for murder.

item.title: Wheelchair-dump deputy charged
item.description: A US sheriff's deputy who dumped a quadriplegic man out of his wheelchair to search him is charged.

item.title: Malaysian police break up protest
item.description: Malaysian police make several arrests after using tear gas and water cannon to break up a protest by ethnic Indians.

item.title: Australia pledges E Timor support
item.description: Australia vows to help safeguard democracy in East Timor after attacks on the president and prime minister.

item.title: Bands set for longer music rights
item.description: Music performers could see a big boost to their lifetime earnings under EU plans to extend music rights.

item.title: Danish MPs refuse to apologise
item.description: Danish MPs cancel a trip to Iran after Tehran demands they apologise for the Muhammad cartoon row.

item.title: UN hints at Iraq refugee returns
item.description: A top UN official hints that security may improve enough soon for 4m displaced Iraqis to begin returning.

item.title: Army intervenes in Beirut clashes
item.description: The Lebanese army intervenes to break up clashes between rival political factions in Beirut.

item.title: India-Pakistan flights to double
item.description: Pakistan and India agree to double the number of weekly passenger flights between the two countries.

item.title: 'Monsoon risk' to cyclone victims
item.description: More than 1.3m Bangladeshis hit by Cyclone Sidr will face monsoon rains in inadequate shelter, Oxfam warns.

item.title: Parents get new sex crime checks
item.description: Parents will be able to check if a named individual has child sex convictions under trials of a new policy.

item.title: AOL 'contemplates Yahoo approach'
item.description: AOL has held talks with Yahoo about a possible deal to fend off an approach from Microsoft, a report says.

item.title: Spinal injury regeneration hope
item.description: Scientists believe they are close to a significant breakthrough in the treatment of spinal injuries.

item.title: Machines 'to match man by 2029'
item.description: Machines will achieve human level artificial intelligence by 2029, a leading US inventor predicts.

item.title: Net firms reject monitoring role
item.description: Net providers in the UK are resisting calls for them to police what customers do online.

item.title: Golden Bear for 'corruption' film
item.description: The Elite Squad, portraying corrupt Brazilian police, is best film in Berlin, while Britain's Sally Hawkins is top actress.

item.title: Have you got a good story? What do you want to talk about?
item.description: Are there topics you want to get the world to talk about? What do you want to comment on or find out what others think about? Set the agenda for global conversations and have your say.
